pullRequest.title: Fix various issues identified via sonarcloud
pullRequest.bodyText:
CookieUtils > Address theoretical NPE on cookie name.
ReportGenerator > Use try-with-resource.
diff_match_patch > equals(Object) add null and type check, add override notation.
EncodeDecodeDialog > Rename initialize() to init() to avoid name collision with parent.
HttpsInfoOutputPanel > Address theoretical NPE in getTarget.
ImagelocationScanRule > Assign to value from the toLowerCase operation.
ImportLogAPI > Use try-with-resource.
PortScan > Use try-with-resource.
RetireScanRule > Address theoretical NPE on repo.

I didn't update CHANGELOGs as these changes don't seem end-user relevant.
Signed-off-by: kingthorin kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com

beforeCommit.message:
Fix various issues identified via sonarcloud

- CookieUtils > Address theoretical NPE on cookie name.
- PayloadIterator > `next()` method should throw NoSuchElementException
for iteration beyond the end of the collection.
- ReportGenerator > Use try-with-resource.
- diff_match_patch > `equals(Object)` add null and type check, add
override notation.1132
- EncodeDecodeDialog > Rename `initialize()` to `init()` to avoid name
collision with parent.
- HttpsInfoOutputPanel > Address theoretical NPE in getTarget.
- ImagelocationScanRule > Assign to value from the toLowerCase
operation.
- ImportLogAPI > Use try-with-resource.
- PortScan > Use try-with-resource.
- RetireScanRule > Address theoretical NPE on repo.

I didn't update CHANGELOGs as these changes don't seem end-user
relevant.

Signed-off-by: kingthorin <kingthorin@users.noreply.github.com>

nodes.bodyText: This advances the internal iterator, which would cause the PayloadIterator to skip payloads. Could you add tests?
Should it just show that the target is invalid?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -123,7 +123,10 @@ public void run() {
                             String warnMsg =
                                     Constant.messages.getString(
                                             "httpsinfo.init.warning",
-                                            getTarget().toString(),
+                                            getTarget() == null
+                                                    ? Constant.messages.getString(
+                                                            "httpsinfo.init.warning.missing")
+                                                    : getTarget().toString(),

nodes.bodyText: This needs to be removed (causing the build to fail).
Should not catch the exception to keep the same behaviour.
getRepo() == null, this could be done in the initial if.
